result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles J. Rush was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--Buy Money reimbursement in the amount of $120 (joint and several with Jesse Ponyicsanyi)
--To pay drug testing fee in the amount of $50 (joint and several with Jesse Ponyicsanyi) 
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening (at least once per month for first three months)
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession of any controlled substance without valid prescription
--no contact with Jesse Ponyicsanyi
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment, per Agent

Arresting Agency: JCSD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

  Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

timeConds.notes:
--To serve  30 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/work-release privileges-both counts concurrent ; The conditional jail is to be served on Mr. Rush's non-work days, Mr. Rush is to notify his Probation Agent his work schedule; this sentence is to commence on the first available non-work days following 1/23/2016. Mr. Rush is to serve his conditional jail time on his non-working days, until the 30 days are served.
Concurrent with:

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 3:36pm [mo]
Defendant Charles J. Rush in court with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Rush

On Counts #2 and #4, the Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Rush on Probation for a period of 18 months, with the following conditions:

--To serve  30 days   in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/work-release privileges both counts concurrent ; The conditional jail is to be served on Mr. Rush's non-work days, Mr. Rush is to notify his Probation Agent his work schedule; this sentence is to commence on the first available non-work days following 1/23/2016. Mr. Rush is to serve his conditional jail time on his non-working days, until the 30 days are served. 
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening (at least once per month for first three months)
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession of any controlled substance without valid prescription
--no contact with Jesse Ponyicsanyi
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment, per Agent
--Buy Money reimbursement in the amount of $120 (joint and several with Jesse Ponyicsanyi)
--To pay drug testing fee in the amount of $50 (joint and several with Jesse Ponyicsanyi) 
--On Count #2: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #4: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge

0 credit for time served
Mr. Rush is to report to the Jefferson Probation Office on Monday 10/12/15 by close of office. 
recess: 4:12pm
With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 8:48am [mo]
Defendant Charles J. Rush in court with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance

On Joint Motion of the Parties, the Court amends to Count #2 and Count #4 to be contrary to sec. 961.41(3g)(e) and 939.05 of the Wis. Stat., Possession of a Controlled Substance, THC, without a valid prescription as Party to a Crime.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " Guilty " entered on Amended Counts #2 and #4; factual basis stipulated;the Court accepts the pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.


Sentencing arguments given by ADA Teuber
--Atty. Fischer indicates that Mr. Rush does not believe some of the prior convictions recited by ADA Teuber are correct
--The Court adjourns the Sentencing to allow further investigation of Mr. Rush's prior convictions.
recess:9:13am

NEXT: Sentencing on 10/9/2015 at 3:45pm
Proposed Stipulation and Order for Continuance of the 9/14/15 Plea & Sentencing

Case called at 11:00am 
Defendant Charles J. Rush in court with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--the Defense stands mute; pleas of "not guilty" entered on Counts #2 and #4 on behalf of Defense by the Court

Atty. Fischer requests a plea and sentencing date out 30 days

NEXT:   Plea/Sentencing: 9/14/2015 at 9:30am

Case called at 10:08am [mo]
Defendant Charles J. Rush in court with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance
Atty. Fischer indicates that he has had meetings with the State and anticipates a possible agreement. Atty. Fischer further indicates that he wishes to proceed with a waiver of prelim hearing today.

Mr.Rush waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
ADA Shock submits Information to the Court; Atty. Fischer waives reading
Atty. Fischer requests that the Arraignment occur at the next hearing, which will likely be a Plea/Sentencing.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling
recess:10:17am 



NEXT:  Arraignment/ Likely Plea/Sentencing: July 20, 2015 at 10:30am
Status conference on June 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 10, 2015 at 11:00 am.

[MK] case called at 2:15pm. 
Defendant Charles J. Rush in court with Attorney Joseph F Fischer.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Rush verifies that the date of birth and address on the Criminal Complaint are correct.
Service of the Criminal Complaint admitted, the charges and maximum penalties are recited, the reading of the factual portion of the Criminal Complaint is waived.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2,500 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no contact with Co-Defendant Jesse M. Ponyicsanyi
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--to take all prescription drugs as prescribed
--no possession of drug paraphernalia 
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking
recess 2:25pm. 


NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 6/10/15 at 11:00am (2) Status Conference on 6/30/15 at 10:00am (Co-Defendant's case is set for Initial Appearance on 6/2/15)
